title: 18 Davinci Resolve Hacks I Wish I Knew Earlier
relevance: DaVinci Resolve tutorial — not a competitor format but a direct source of editing techniques for our post-production workflow. Covers Power Bins, Adjustment Clips, Fairlight Presets, Noise Reduction shared nodes, Smart Bins, and multi-track audio organization. All techniques applicable to Rayviews Resolve assembly pipeline.
summary: 18 DaVinci Resolve productivity hacks demonstrated in Resolve 20 Studio. Screen recordings show complex multi-track timeline (3+ video tracks, 6+ audio tracks), Power Bins with organized folders, Adjustment Clips on V2, Fairlight Configuration Presets, shared Noise Reduction nodes in Color page, and Smart Bins. Cinematic B-roll inserts (keyboard close-ups, nature footage) break up screen recordings. 178K views with 7.5% like ratio indicates high audience value.

key_insights.insight: Power Bins persist across all projects at the database level — store reusable assets (text templates, transitions, music, SFX) once and access in every new video project
Adjustment Clips on V2 apply effects (color, zoom, blur) to all clips below without modifying source — critical for batch processing 25-35 product images per video
Fairlight Configuration Presets save entire audio setup (track layout, bus routing, EQ, levels) as named presets — guarantees consistent audio across all videos
Shared Noise Reduction nodes in Color page propagate changes to all clips using them — tune denoising once for AI-generated video artifacts
Smart Bins auto-sort clips by metadata (resolution, file type, duration) — handles our mixed-source assets (4K images, 1080p video, WAV audio) without manual filing
Professional 6-track audio layout (Camera, Music, SFX Intro, Ambience, AmbienSFX, PracticalSFX) — validates our 4-track approach (VO, Music, SFX, Ambience)
Keyboard shortcut overlays (OPTION+CMD+Y) shown as large semi-transparent text over timeline — effective tutorial technique and validates custom shortcut workflow
Screen recording + cinematic B-roll alternation prevents tutorial monotony — B-roll breaks every 3-5 tips with keyboard close-ups and nature footage

editing_style.transitions: hard cuts for screen recordings, cross-dissolves into B-roll inserts
editing_style.text_overlays: keyboard shortcut overlays (large semi-transparent text), minimal tip labels
editing_style.graphics: minimal — no animated intros or branded bumpers
editing_style.pacing: ~50 seconds per tip, B-roll breaks every 3-5 tips, screen recordings 20-40s each
editing_style.camera_work: screen recording (primary), cinematic B-roll inserts (Sony FX3, shallow DOF)
editing_style.product_presentation: N/A — tutorial format, not product review
editing_style.structure: hook (B-roll montage) → [B-roll intro → screen recording demo → shortcut overlay] x18 → closing (CTA)
editing_style.music: subtle ambient during B-roll, quieter during screen recordings
editing_style.effects: none visible beyond standard Resolve UI

production_budget_estimate.note: Zero credits — these are DaVinci Resolve configuration techniques, not asset generation. One-time setup (~30 min) then reused across all videos.

action_items.action: Create Power Bins in Resolve: Ray Avatar, Text Templates, Transitions, Music Library, SFX Library
Save 'Rayviews Standard' Fairlight Preset with 4-track layout (VO -16, Music -26, SFX -18 LUFS) and bus routing
Create Adjustment Clip template on V2 with standard zoom (3-7%) and color settings for batch product image processing
Set up Smart Bins by file type (png/mp4/wav) and resolution (4K/1080p) for auto-sorting imported assets
Create shared Noise Reduction node for AI-generated video clips (Dzine/Minimax) with Temporal + Spatial NR settings
Define keyboard shortcuts for frequent Resolve assembly operations (place clip, ripple delete, blade, etc.)
